descriptions: Student is unable to classify foods into any food groups or demonstrates significant misunderstanding of food groups.
Student can classify a few foods into the correct food groups with major errors and demonstrates limited understanding of food groups.
Student can classify some foods into the correct food groups with noticeable errors and demonstrates some understanding of food groups.
Student can classify most foods into the correct food groups with minor errors and demonstrates a general understanding of food groups.
Student can accurately classify almost all foods into the correct food groups and demonstrates a solid understanding of food groups.
Student can accurately classify all foods into the correct food groups and demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of food groups, including subgroups and variations.
Student does not demonstrate any understanding of why food groups are important for health.
Student demonstrates minimal understanding of why food groups are important for health with little to no explanation.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of why food groups are important for health with a limited explanation.
Student demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of why food groups are important for health with a reasonable explanation.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of why food groups are important for health with a clear and detailed explanation.

Student demonstrates an exceptional understanding of why food groups are important for health, providing a comprehensive and insightful explanation, including the role of each food group in maintaining overall health and preventing diseases.
Student classifies only one or two foods.
Student classifies a limited range of foods (3-4).
Student classifies a moderate range of foods (5-6).
Student classifies a good range of foods (7-8).
Student classifies a wide range of foods (9-10).
Student classifies an extensive range of foods (more than 10), demonstrating knowledge of diverse dietary options within each food group.
